description:
Hi ! Thanks for watching !

Final revision  is a crop on M8 at native resolution , original revision is full sensor. I prefer the close-up view :-)

I found M8 really challenging to process. 

First challenge was M8 brightness/contrast : the core is so bright that if you do not use HDR functions, you can not get both the nebula and the background context with a good exposition. I had never use HDR and it was a hard learning curve.  Not sure I found the right spot on this M8.

Second challenge was color : I wanted to keep good stars and nebula colors. I looked at a lot of RGB M8 and did not really manage to find a reference color here on Astrobin. Found the Adam Block's version beautiful and useful to check stars and nebs colors. Mine a bit more blueish.

Third challenge was "No starless", I tried and found it difficult to go starless processing in RGB. Also I did not manage to achieve a good  result using Ha as Lum so I finally created a synthetic Lum with RGB. This was used as luminance in the image. A starless Ha was used to increase core details (high pass).

I really struggled to achieve this final version (Revision BD!) and still not sure about it...

Thanks for reading !
title: M8 - Dive in the Lagoon
